user_query: What strategies is UNDP implementing to support Angola's Bureau of External Relations and Advocacy?
answer:
The UNDP is implementing several strategies to support Angola's Bureau of External Relations and Advocacy. One of the strategies is partnering with the government to drive policies and actions that focus on disaster risk reduction, increasing resilience, and enabling adaptive capacities. This is aimed at reducing the long-term vulnerability of the population and protecting development investments, particularly in at-risk areas.

Additionally, the UNDP is working with civil society and the government to improve human capacities and data systems for performance, transparency, and planning. They are also focusing on the quality of services and the rule of law in collaboration with other United Nations partners.

Furthermore, the UNDP has established multi-stakeholder partnerships on priorities for the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). They are aligning their results framework with indicators related to European Union accession, the National Statistical Development Indicator (NSDI), and the national indicator framework for the SDGs.

The UNDP is also employing national monitoring systems, official statistical data, and reports from line ministries, development partners, and research institutions to measure its contribution to national results. This monitoring and evaluation plan will be implemented following endorsement by the Executive Board.

Overall, the UNDP is actively supporting Angola's Bureau of External Relations and Advocacy through various strategies, including partnerships with the government, focusing on the SDGs, and implementing monitoring and evaluation plans.

doc-31.title: UN Country programme document for Angola (2020-2022)
doc-31.extract: Executive Board of the United Nations Development Programme, the United Nations Population Fund and the United Nations Office for Project Services Distr.: General 1 July 2019 Original: English 1911135X (E) 230719 Second regular session 2019 3 to 6 September 2019, New York Item 3 of the provisional agenda Country programmes and related matters Country programme document for Angola (2020-2022) Contents Page I. Programme rationale..................................................................................................... 2 II. Programme priorities and partnerships………………………………………………….……….… 4 III. Programme and risk management.................................................................................... 7 IV. Monitoring and evaluation…………………………………………………….…………………… 8 Annex Results and resources framework for Angola (2020-2022) 10I. Programme rationale 1. The 2017 general elections ushered in a new era in Angola, with a change of President after 38 years. There is strong political commitment to strengthen democratic governance, justice and human rights, and fight corruption. Creating the first-ever elected local governments in 2020 is a flagship policy. 2. Governance, justice and human rights institutions at national and local levels remain fragile in responding to ongoing structural

relations.subject: UNDP Strategic Plan
relations.object: Bureau of External Relations and Advocacy
relations.description: The country office is developing a country programme action plan (CPAP), which includes a partnerships strategy and action plan for resource mobilization, with Bureau of External Relations and Advocacy (BERA) support, and a communication strategy.
